meta_description: The National Music Museum is a world-renowned center for the collection, study, preservation, and exhibition of musical instruments and their related ephemera. The NMM is one of the largest institutions of its kind in the world.
hours_text:
## Admission

NMM Live! Events are included in Museum Admission. More discounts may be available, inquire at the front desk!

NMM Members

Adult

Senior Citizens (65+)  
Children (up to 18)  
USD Faculty/Staff/Students

FREE

$10

$8

$5

FREE

We do not accept bills larger than $20. Thank you!

## Location

414 E. Clark Street 

At the corner of E. Clark and Yale Streets

University of South Dakota  
Vermillion, South Dakota 57069  
United States

​

Find us on the Map below!

## Media Guide

Open our new Multimedia Guide, with self-guided tours featuring additional audio, images, and text narration. 

​

If you have a favorite pair of headphones, we recommend you bring your own. Limited wired and wireless headphones are available for check-out or purchase at the NMM.

​

[Explore the Media Guide](https://nmm.stqry.app)

## Accessibility

There is accessible parking in the lot to the East of the building near wheelchair-friendly ramp access to the NMM. Once inside, we have a few transport chairs and folding museum stools that visitors may borrow for their visit. We also have seating located throughout the galleries so that guests may rest while touring the collections. 

We are also excited to welcome families to the museum, and thus allow families to bring a stroller for their young children. We also have a private room available on request for anyone breastfeeding a child.

If we can accommodate you in another way, please talk to a staff member and we will do our best to m...
